          "id": "7c530739-5925-4d08-acce-5473eb45f433",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551936353373,
          "parent_id": "b44243a6-8322-4e1b-a2df-5d2b4979d8c1",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["This happens because the "],
              ["definition", [["i"]]],
              [" for "],
              ["pow()", [["c"]]],
              [
                " wasnâ€™t found during the linking stage. To fix this we have to specify we want to link against the math library called "
              ],
              ["libm", [["c"]]],
              [" by specifying the "],
              ["-lm", [["c"]]],
              [" flag. (Note that there are platforms such as macOS where "],
              ["-lm", [["c"]]],
              [
                " is not needed, but when you get the undefined reference, the library is needed.)"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["We see here a "],
              ["declaration", [["i"]]],
              [" of foo ("],
              ["int foo();", [["c"]]],
              [") but no "],
              ["definition", [["i"]]],
              [
                " of it (actual function). So we provided the compiler with the function header, but there was no such function defined anywhere, so the compilation stage passes but the linker exits with an "
              ],
              ["Undefined reference", [["c"]]],
              [" error."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
